author: Nostalgia Nerd
description:
Nintendo didn’t actually make Donkey Kong.
The game that created Mario was built by a Tokyo broadcast-equipment company called Ikegami Tsushinki; working from Miyamoto’s design notes on 8-inch floppy disks.

In 1980, Nintendo’s arcade flop Radar Scope left thousands of machines gathering dust in U.S. warehouses. Desperate to survive, they hired Ikegami to re-code the boards into something new. Three frantic months later, Donkey Kong was born; a mix of creative chaos, quick fixes, and pure brilliance.

The result? Nintendo’s first worldwide hit… and a lawsuit that followed soon after.

#DonkeyKong #Nintendo #RetroGaming #GamingHistory #Mario #VideoGameFacts #80sArcade #NostalgiaNerd
title: Nintendo Didn't Create Donkey Kong
